newsitem.title: USA: Georgia Gulf Q1 hurt by drop in prices.
newsitem.headline: Georgia Gulf Q1 hurt by drop in prices.

text.p: Chemicals manufacturer Georgia Gulf Corp said Monday its first quarter results were hurt by a substantial drop in caustic soda pricing.
It reported improvements in its aromatic chemicals, methanol and vinyl compounds divisions.
Georgia Gulf reported first quarter earnings per share of $0.35, down from $0.42 a year ago.

It said results from its aromatic chemicals division improved in spite of lower acetone prices and higher raw material costs. The methane division's profits increased as a result of stronger demand, it said.
The vinyl compounds unit achieved good results although the remainder of the vinyl chain continued to be disappointing as a result of higher raw material costs.
"While we are not satisfied with the overall results for the first quarter, they were basically in line with our expectations," Jerry Satrum, president and chief executive, said in a statement.

He said the coming completion of the firm's capital expansion and modernization program will bring on additional capacity and cost reductions and will allow the firm to return to a more normalized production schedule with less disruptions.
